newsitem.title: USA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-DUCKS EDGE BLACKHAWKS, DETROIT AND SAN JOSE WIN.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-DUCKS EDGE BLACKHAWKS, DETROIT AND SAN JOSE WIN.

text.p: Paul Kariya and J.J. Daigneault scored 59 seconds apart in the first period as the Mighty Ducks of Anaheim held on for a 4-3 victory over the Chicago Blackhawks on Friday.
Kariya had a goal and an assist, as did Mike LeClerc, who was playing his first NHL game.
Sergei Krivokrasov and Tony Amonte each had a goal and an assist for the Blackhawks, who remained tied with Calgary for the final playoff berth in the West.

In Detroit, Larry Murphy's point shot skipped through Steve Shields' pads 3:10 into the extra session, giving the Detroit Red Wings their second straight overtime win, 2-1, over the slumping Buffalo Sabres.
Matthew Barnaby's goal with 5:57 remaining sent the game to overtime. Buffalo continued to struggle on the power play, going 0-for-6 as it suffered its season-high third straight loss.
In San Jose, Owen Nolan and Darren Turcotte each scored twice and Ed Belfour made 22 saves as the San Jose Sharks snapped a three-game losing streak with a 4-3 victory over the Edmonton Oilers.
Nolan scored his 30th goal and added an assist and Doug Bodger collected two assists for the Sharks, who won for just the second time in 10 games.
Ryan Smyth, Mats Lindgren and Andrei Kovalenko scored for Edmonton.
